intro: Pisum sativum subvar. phaeospermum, commonly known as the dark-seeded pea, is a botanical variant of the common pea. It is characterized by its dark-colored seeds, which range from brown to nearly black in hue. This subspecies typically produces compact, upright plants with trifoliate leaves and small, pea-shaped flowers. The pods are usually green and contain 2–5 seeds. It is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique seed coloration and is also used in certain traditional cuisines.
